adaboost.description: This is a tool for classification. input two csv files, namely the training set and the test set. Also input a column name for the label column. Use this tool to train on the training set, then predict on the test set, and output the prediction result file on the test set. the output result file adds a predicted value column "Predicted" compared to the input test set. The algorithm used is AdaBoost algorithm.

input.name: train_csv_file
input.description: This is the input training set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: test_csv_file
input.description: This is the input test set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: target
input.description: This is the column name of the input label column. It is a string

output.name: result_csv_file
output.description: The output is the result file of the test set. It is a csv file with a total of (n+1) columns. The column name of the predicted value column is "Predicted"

bam_to_vcf.description: GATK haplotype caller to identify genomic variants, it converting BAM alignment files of individual samples into VCF (Variant Call Format) format

input.name: bam_file
input.description: BAM alignment files

output.name: vcf_file
output.description: Variant Call Format files

bam_to_vcf_mutect2.description: GATK mutect2 caller to identify somatic variants, it converting BAM alignment files of paired samples (tumor and normal) into VCF (Variant Call Format) format

input.name: bam_file
input.description: BAM alignment files of tumor

input.name: bam_file
input.description: BAM alignment files of normal

output.name: vcf_file
output.description: somatic Variant Call Format files

basicunet.description: Construct a cell segmentation model with basicunet using the training dataset of pathological images.

input.name: training_dataset_path
input.description: training dataset path, Compressed file containing training data

input.name: cell_type
input.description: The types of cells to be divided can be inflammatory, epithelial, spindle shaped, all, where inflammatory, epithelial and spindle shaped represent inflammatory cells respectively. epithelial cell, spindle shaped cell, and all stands for dividing all type of cells.

output.name: model_file_path
output.description: cell segmentation model file

basicunet_predict.description: Using basicunet model to perform cell segmentation on testing dataset of pathological images.

input.name: testing_dataset_path
input.description: testing dataset path, Compressed file containing testing data

input.name: model_file_path
input.description: cell segmentation model file

output.name: result_file_path
output.description: cell segmentation result file path

bwa_samtools_sambamba.description: This tool convert fastq files into alignment BAM files. It firstly uses BWA for sequence alignment, then use Samtools convert the alignment results into BAM file, and finally uses Sambamba for sorting the Bam file.

input.name: fastq_file1
input.description: In high-throughput sequencing, one of the two related FASTQ files obtained contains the sequence information and quality scores of one end of a DNA fragment.

input.name: fastq_file2
input.description: In high-throughput sequencing, one of the two related FASTQ files obtained contains the sequence information and quality scores of one end of a DNA fragment.

input.name: file_type_flag
input.description: The type of fastq file ("tumor" or "normal")

output.name: bam_file
output.description: BAM alignment files

calculate_classify_metrics.description: This is a tool for calculating evaluation metrics for classification tasks. Input a prediction file and input the column name of the label column and the column name of the prediction column in the prediction file. This tool is then used to calculate the evaluation metrics for the classification. The tool finally outputs a result file of evaluation metrics. And output four floating point numbers, namely accuracy, precision, recall, and F1 score.

input.name: csv_file
input.description: This is the input csv file. It contains label columns and predicted value columns

input.name: target_col
input.description: This is the column name of the label column in the input csv file. it is a string

input.name: predicted_col
input.description: This is the column name of the predicted value column in the input csv file. it is a string

output.name: result_csv_file
output.description: The result file contains the evaluation metrics of the classification task, such as TP, TN, FP, FN, accuracy, precision, recall, f1 score. It is a csv file

output.name: accuracy
output.description: This is the output accuracy value. It is a floating point number

output.name: precision
output.description: This is the output precision value. It is a floating point number

output.name: recall
output.description: This is the output recall value. It is a floating point number

output.name: f1_score
output.description: This is the output f1_score value. It is a floating point number

cel2matrix.description: Cel2matrix is a tool for extracting expression profile data from CEL files and annotating probes.

input.name: CEL_file
input.description: The folder containing CEL format files for chip data.

input.name: out_folder
input.description: A unique run id and output folder name [a-zA-Z0-9_-]+

input.name: gpl_name
input.description: Probe annotation corresponding to CEL file.

output.name: matrix_file
output.description: The expression profile file extracted from the CEL format file of chip data, in the form of gene, is listed as a sample.

cellranger_count.description: cellranger count takes FASTQ files and performs alignment, filtering, barcode counting, and UMI counting. It uses the Chromium cellular barcodes to generate feature-barcode matrices, determine clusters, and perform gene expression analysis.

input.name: fastq_files
input.description: compressed file path to input FASTQ data(A sample contains I1:SRRXXX_S1_LOO1_I1_001.fastq.gz;R1:SRRXXX_S1_LOO1_R1_001.fastq.gz;R2:SRRXXX_S1_LOO1_R2_001.fastq.gz)

input.name: sample_name
input.description: Prefix of the filenames of FASTQs to select

output.name: filtered_feature_bc_matrix_file
output.description: Filtered Barcode Information HDF5 Format File.

output.name: raw_feature_bc_matrix_file
output.description: Raw Barcode Information HDF5 Format File.

decisiontree.description:
This is a tool for classification. input two csv files, namely the training set and the test set. Also input a column name for the label column. Use this tool to train on the training set, then predict on the test set, and output the prediction result file on the test set. the output result file adds a predicted value column "Predicted" compared to the input test set.
The algorithm used is Decision tree algorithm.

input.name: train_csv_file
input.description: This is the input training set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: test_csv_file
input.description: This is the input test set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: target
input.description: This is the column name of the input label column. It is a string

output.name: result_csv_file
output.description: The output is the result file of the test set. It is a csv file with a total of (n+1) columns. The column name of the predicted value column is "Predicted"

deg.description: For extracting differentially expressed genes from samples under two different experimental conditions.

input.name: exp_file
input.description: gene expression profile data file.

input.name: group_file
input.description: File Contains grouping information for samples.

output.name: deg_file
output.description: The set of genes significantly differentially expressed under the two experimental conditions.

enrichment2bubble.description: enrichment2bubble is a tool to Display the results of pathway enrichment using a bubble chart.

input.name: enrichment_file
input.description: The enrichment text file. The following column names must be included: Term, Input_number, Enrich_ratio, P_Value

input.name: p_value
input.description: The column name in enrichment file where the p-value is located.

input.name: term
input.description: The column name in enrichment file where the pathway is located.

input.name: input_number
input.description: The column name in enrichment file where the input number is located.

input.name: background_number
input.description: The column name in enrichment file where the background number is located.

output.name: out_bubble_image
output.description: The bubble figure.

fastqc.description: fastqc is a tool used for quality control of high throughput sequence data. It provides a simple way to perform quality checks on raw sequence data coming from high throughput sequencing pipelines.

input.name: fq1_data
input.description: The input file is a FASTQ file containing the forward reads from a paired-end sequencing run. This file contains raw sequencing reads.

input.name: fq2_data
input.description: The input file is a FASTQ file containing the reverse reads from a paired-end sequencing run. This file contains raw sequencing reads

output.name: fq1_data_txt
output.description: The output file is a text file that contains detailed quality metrics for the forward reads from the input sequence data. It includes various statistics and data points to help assess the quality of the data.

output.name: fq2_data_txt
output.description: The output file is a text file that contains detailed quality metrics for the reverse reads from the input sequence data. It includes various statistics and data points to help assess the quality of the data.

output.name: fq1_summary_txt
output.description: The output file is a summary text file that provides a high-level overview of the quality metrics for the forward reads from the input sequence data. It includes key quality statistics and indicators.

output.name: fq2_summary_txt
output.description: The output file is a summary text file that provides a high-level overview of the quality metrics for the reverse reads from the input sequence data. It includes key quality statistics and indicators.

fastq_to_bam.description: This tool is a pipeline that uses the following tools in sequence:1bwa_samtools_sambamba 2gatk_markduplicates 3gatk_bqsr, complete the conversion from fastq to bam file, gatk_markduplicates is used to identify and label duplicate reads generated during the PCR process to avoid bias in subsequent analysis. Finally, gatk_bqsr recalibrates the base mass fraction in the BAM file

input.name: fastq_file1
input.description: One of the paired sequencing, Genetic testing data files for patients with genetic diseases

input.name: fastq_file2
input.description: One of the paired sequencing, Genetic testing data files for patients with genetic diseases

input.name: file_type_flag
input.description: The type of fastq file ("tumor" or "normal")

output.name: bam_file
output.description: BAM file that has had duplicates removed and Base Quality Score Recalibration (BQSR)

featureselect.description: Input two csv files with m columns, which are the training set and the test set. And input the column name of the label column, and the number of features to be selected, n, where n is less than m. Use this tool to perform feature selection on the training set. Then filter the feature columns of the test set according to the n feature columns selected from the training set. The output result files are two csv files, which are the training set and test set files after feature extraction. Each csv file contains filtered n feature columns and label columns.

input.name: train_csv_file
input.description: This is the input training set. It is a csv file with a total of m columns.

input.name: test_csv_file
input.description: This is the input test set. It is a csv file with a total of m columns.

input.name: target
input.description: This is the column name of the input label column. It is a string

input.name: n
input.description: This is the number of feature columns that need to be filtered out. It is an integer type

output.name: train_result_file
output.description: This is the result file of the feature extraction of the training set. It is a csv file with n+1 columns in total. It contains the extracted n highly correlated feature columns and a label column.

output.name: test_result_file
output.description: This is the result file of the feature extraction of the test set. It is a csv file with n+1 columns in total. It contains the extracted n highly correlated feature columns and a label column.

gatk_bqsr.description: A tool in GATK for Base Quality Score Recalibration (BQSR)

input.name: bam_file1
input.description: BAM alignment files

output.name: bam_file2
output.description: BAM alignment files

gatk_markduplicates.description: A tool in GATK to identify and mark duplicate reads in alignment bam file.

input.name: bam_file1
input.description: BAM alignment files

output.name: bam_file2
output.description: BAM alignment files

gaussianNB.description: Input two csv files, namely the training set and the test set. Also input a column name for the label column. Use this tool to train on the training set, then predict on the test set, and output the prediction result file on the test set. The output result file adds a predicted value column "Predicted" compared to the input test set. The algorithm used is GaussianNB algorithm.

input.name: train_csv_file
input.description: This is the input training set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: test_csv_file
input.description: This is the input test set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: target
input.description: This is the column name of the input label column. It is a string.

output.name: result_csv_file
output.description: The output is the result file of the test set. It is a csv file with a total of (n+1) columns. The column name of the predicted value column is "Predicted".

gbdt.description:
This is a tool for classification. input two csv files, namely the training set and the test set. Also input a column name for the label column. Use this tool to train on the training set, then predict on the test set, and output the prediction result file on the test set. the output result file adds a predicted value column "Predicted" compared to the input test set.
The algorithm used is GBDT algorithm.

input.name: train_csv_file
input.description: This is the input training set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: test_csv_file
input.description: This is the input test set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: target
input.description: This is the column name of the input label column. It is a string

output.name: result_csv_file
output.description: The output is the result file of the test set. It is a csv file with a total of (n+1) columns. The column name of the predicted value column is "Predicted"

gene_to_diseases.description: The tool utilizes pathgenic variant gene names to perform searches within the OMIM database

input.name: pathogenic_genes_file
input.description: maf file or json file include pathgenic variant gene name

output.name: diseases_name
output.description: a list include names of diseases that may be caused by genetic mutations

gffcompare.description: It is a tool for comparing and merging GTF/GFF format files.

input.name: gtf_file
input.description: This is StringTie's output file containing information about the assembled transcripts, usually generated by StringTie's merge operation.

output.name: merged_stats
output.description: Includes statistics on the number of transcripts matched, the number of new transcripts, the number of known transcripts, etc.

output.name: merged_loci
output.description: Each of these transcripts contains detailed information corresponding to a gene in the reference genome.

output.name: merged_tracking
output.description: Detailed information on the correspondence between the input transcripts and the genes in the reference genome.

GSEA.description: Detect the expression changes of differentially expressed gene sets under specific conditions through predefined gene sets, thereby revealing the biological functions influenced by these differentially expressed genes.

input.name: DEG_file
input.description: Differentially expressed genes under specific conditions.

input.name: Predefined_gene_set_file
input.description: This file contains information on biological functions and corresponding gene sets, which can be defined by users themselves, such as KEGG pathway-gene and GO term-gene relationships.

output.name: GSEA_file
output.description: GSEA enrichment result file, including which biological functions were activated or inhibited by differentially expressed genes.

hierarchical.description: This is a clustering tool. Input a csv file and also enter the number of clusters. Use this tool to perform cluster analysis on csv files and output the clustering result file and a silhouette score value. Compared with the input csv file, the clustering result file adds the clustered category column "Cluster" column. The algorithm used is hierarchical clustering algorithm.

input.name: data_csv_file
input.description: This is the input original data set. It is a csv file with n columns.

input.name: n_clusters
input.description: This is the number of clusters to be clustered. It is an integer.

output.name: result_csv_file
output.description: This is the result file of the clustering. It is a csv file with (n+1) columns. The column name of the new column is "Cluster"

output.name: silhouette
output.description: This is the average silhouette score of the output. It is a floating point number between -1 and 1 used to evaluate the quality of the clustering.

HISAT2.description: A tool for aligning RNA sequences to a reference genome.

input.name: FASTQ_file1
input.description: This is the forward read of the FASTQ file and contains the raw RNA sequence data from sequencing.

input.name: FASTQ_file2
input.description: This is the reverse read FASTQ file containing the reverse read sequence corresponding to the first file.

output.name: SAM_file
output.description: Results after alignment of FASTQ sequence data to the reference genome.

hovernet.description: Construct a cell segmentation model with hovernet using the training dataset of pathological images.

input.name: training_dataset_path
input.description: training dataset path, Compressed file containing training data

input.name: cell_type
input.description: The types of cells to be divided can be inflammatory, epithelial, spindle shaped, all, where inflammatory, epithelial and spindle shaped represent inflammatory cells respectively. epithelial cell, spindle shaped cell, and all stands for dividing all type of cells.

output.name: model_file_path
output.description: cell segmentation model file

hovernet_predict.description: Using hovernet model to perform cell segmentation on testing dataset of pathological images.

input.name: testing_dataset_path
input.description: testing dataset path, Compressed file containing testing datami

input.name: model_file_path
input.description: cell segmentation model file

output.name: result_file_path
output.description: cell segmentation result file path

intervar_mutation_annotation.description: This tool analyzes genetic mutations in VCF files and automatically queries the InterVar database to determine whether these mutations are pathogenic.

input.name: vcf_file
input.description: Variant Call Format files

output.name: annotated_file
output.description: The file is a JSON array containing information about genetic mutations, where "Pathogenicity" being "Pathogenic" indicates that the gene is a disease-causing gene.

kallisto.description: kallisto is a tool used for quantifying transcript abundances from RNA-seq data.

input.name: fq1_data
input.description: The input file is a FASTQ file containing the forward reads from an RNA-seq experiment. This file contains raw sequencing reads.

input.name: fq2_data
input.description: The input file is a FASTQ file containing the reverse reads from an RNA-seq experiment. This file contains raw sequencing reads.

output.name: out_file
output.description: The output file is a tab-delimited text file containing the quantification results. Each row represents a gene and its corresponding expression abundance value.

kmeans.description: This is a clustering tool. Input a csv file and also enter the number of clusters. Use this tool to perform cluster analysis on csv files and output the clustering result file and a silhouette score value. Compared with the input csv file, the clustering result file adds the clustered category column "Cluster" column. The algorithm used is kmeans clustering algorithm.

input.name: data_csv_file
input.description: This is the input original data set. It is a csv file with n columns.

input.name: n_clusters
input.description: This is the number of clusters to be clustered. It is an integer.

output.name: result_csv_file
output.description: This is the result file of the clustering. It is a csv file with (n+1) columns. The column name of the new column is "Cluster"

output.name: silhouette
output.description: This is the average silhouette score of the output. It is a floating point number between -1 and 1 used to evaluate the quality of the clustering.

KOBAS_enrichment.description: Gene Set Enrichment (GSE) to resolve the enriched biological functions for a gene set.

input.name: gene_list_file
input.description: A gene set that will be used to perform functional enrichment analysis(No preprocessing required).

output.name: GO_enrichment_result
output.description: GO term affected by the input gene set.

output.name: KEGG_enrichment_result
output.description: KEGG pathway affected by the input gene set.

lda.description: This is a tool for classification. input two csv files, namely the training set and the test set. Also input a column name for the label column. Use this tool to train on the training set, then predict on the test set, and output the prediction result file on the test set. the output result file adds a predicted value column "Predicted" compared to the input test set. The algorithm used is LDA algorithm.

input.name: train_csv_file
input.description: This is the input training set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: test_csv_file
input.description: This is the input test set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: target
input.description: This is the column name of the input label column. It is a string

output.name: result_csv_file
output.description: The output is the result file of the test set. It is a csv file with a total of (n+1) columns. The column name of the predicted value column is "Predicted"

lefse.description: lefse is a tool used for the analysis of high-dimensional biomarker data. It is particularly useful in the field of microbiome research, where it can identify and interpret biomarkers such as taxonomic classifications that exhibit significant differences in abundance across various samples or conditions.

input.name: feature_file
input.description: A text file containing feature abundance. The file's row names are features and column names are samples.(Necessary)

input.name: sample_file
input.description: The sample information text file. The file's row names are samples and column names are sample metadata such as grouping information.(Necessary)

input.name: tax_file
input.description: A text file containing taxonomic information. The file's row names are features and column names are taxonomic classes.(Necessary)

input.name: method
input.description: Statistical Analysis Methods.("lefse", "rf", "metastat", "metagenomeSeq", "KW", "KW_dunn", "wilcox", "t.test", "anova", "scheirerRayHare", "lm", "ancombc2", "ALDEx2_t", "ALDEx2_kw", "DESeq2", "linda", "maaslin2", "betareg", "lme", "glmm", "glmm_beta"),default "lefse"

input.name: group
input.description: The column name where grouping information is located in sample_file.(Necessary)

input.name: alpha
input.description: default 0.05;significance threshold to select taxa when method is "lefse" or "rf"; or used to generate significance letters when method is 'anova' or 'KW_dunn' like the alpha parameter in cal_diff of trans_alpha class.

input.name: taxa_level
input.description: default "all"; 'all' represents using abundance data at all taxonomic ranks; For testing at a specific rank, provide taxonomic rank name, such as "Genus". If the provided taxonomic name is neither 'all' nor a colname in tax_table of input dataset, the function will use the features in input microtable$otu_table automatically.

input.name: p_adjust_method
input.description: p.adjust method("holm", "hochberg", "hommel", "bonferroni", "BH", "BY","fdr", "none"),default "fdr". When p_adjust_method = "none"â€™, P.adj is same with P.unadj

output.name: out_lefse_file
output.description: A text file including results of LEfSe.

logistic.description: input two csv files, namely the training set and the test set. Also input a column name for the label column. Use this tool to train on the training set, then predict on the test set, and output the prediction result file on the test set. the output result file adds a predicted value column "Predicted" compared to the input test set. The algorithm used is logistic algorithm.

input.name: train_csv_file
input.description: This is the input training set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: test_csv_file
input.description: This is the input test set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: target
input.description: This is the column name of the input label column. It is a string.

output.name: result_csv_file
output.description: The output is the result file of the test set. It is a csv file with a total of (n+1) columns. The  column name of the predicted value column is "Predicted"

maf_filter.description: This tool can filter out pathogenic mutation genes from MAF files.

input.name: maf_file
input.description: Mutation annotation information (MAF) format file

output.name: filtered_maf_file
output.description: Mutation annotation information (MAF) format file filtered by maf_filter tool

maf_to_drug.description: A querying tool that returns a list of drugs related to a OncoKB query items. The tool accepts a maf file and returns a two-dimensional list, each element of subarray is a dictionary consisting of two key-value pairs: drug and level.

input.name: maf_file
input.description: maf file

output.name: drugs
output.description: Two-dimensional list, each element of subarray is a dictionary consisting of two key-value pairs: drug and level.

mcpcounter.description: quantification of the absolute abundance of immune cells from gene expression data

input.name: gene_expression
input.description: gene expression profile in tab-delimited text format.

output.name: out_file
output.description: The output file is a tab-delimited text file. It includes different types of immune cells and absolute abundance.

metagenome_annotation.description: metagenome_annotation is a tool to conduct taxonomic identification and quantitative analysis of metagenomic data by using Kraken2 and Bracken, which can obtain the file including count data at the species level for the sample, as well as the taxonomic file.

input.name: id
input.description: The sample name.

input.name: type
input.description: The type of input data files,"paired" for Paired-end sequencing and "single" for Single-end sequencing.

input.name: db
input.description: The database used for annotaion. kraken2_16S is used for the annotation of 16S sequencing data.

input.name: fq1
input.description: A fastq file.

input.name: fq2
input.description: A fastq file. If type="single",fq2 is the default null value.

output.name: out_taxon_file
output.description: A text file containing taxonomic results at seven hierarchical levels.

output.name: out_count_file
output.description: A text file including count data at the species level for the sample.

metagenome_get_taxon_file.description: metagenome_get_taxon_file is a tool to merging multiple taxonomic files from metagenome_annotation into one file which can be used for LEfSe analysis. All the taxonomic files should be placed individually in a single directory.

input.name: work_dir
input.description: The absolute path where the input taxonomic files are located such as "/workdir".

output.name: out_merge_taxon_file
output.description: A text file containing taxonomic results at seven hierarchical levels in all the samples' taxonomic files.

metagenome_merge.description: metagenome_merge is a tool for merging multiple similar files which should be placed individually in a single directory , capable of combining multiple out_count_files obtained from metagenome_annotation into a single count matrix file.

input.name: path
input.description: The absolute path where the input taxonomic files are located, such as "/workdir/".

input.name: item
input.description: Specifications of the columns used for merging.

output.name: out_merge_count_file
output.description: A text file containing taxonomic results at seven hierarchical levels.

mihatp_hovernet.description: Construct a cell segmentation model with mihatp_hovernet using the training dataset of pathological images.

input.name: training_dataset_path
input.description: training dataset path, Compressed file containing training data

input.name: cell_type
input.description: The types of cells to be divided can be inflammatory, epithelial, spindle shaped, all, where inflammatory, epithelial and spindle shaped represent inflammatory cells respectively. epithelial cell, spindle shaped cell, and all stands for dividing all type of cells.

output.name: model_file_path
output.description: cell segmentation model file

mihatp_hovernet_predict.description: Using mihatp_hovernet model to perform cell segmentation on testing dataset of pathological images.

input.name: testing_dataset_path
input.description: testing dataset path, Compressed file containing testing data

input.name: model_file_path
input.description: cell segmentation model file

output.name: result_file_path
output.description: cell segmentation result file path

mlp.description:
This is a tool for classification. input two csv files, namely the training set and the test set. Also input a column name for the label column. Use this tool to train on the training set, then predict on the test set, and output the prediction result file on the test set. the output result file adds a predicted value column "Predicted" compared to the input test set.
The algorithm used is MLP algorithm.

input.name: train_csv_file
input.description: This is the input training set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: test_csv_file
input.description: This is the input test set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: target
input.description: This is the column name of the input label column. It is a string

output.name: result_csv_file
output.description: The output is the result file of the test set. It is a csv file with a total of (n+1) columns. The column name of the predicted value column is "Predicted"

mse_calculate_tool.description: For testing logistic regression tasks, mean square error should be used as much as possible for logistic regression tasks. Input a csv file. And input the column name of the label column and the column name of the predicted value column in the csv file. Then use this tool to calculate the MSE of the prediction and output a floating point number of MSE.

input.name: csv_file
input.description: This is the input csv file. It contains label columns and predicted value columns

input.name: target_col
input.description: This is the column name of the label column in the input csv file. it is a string

input.name: predicted_col
input.description: This is the column name of the predicted value column in the input csv file. it is a string

output.name: accuracy
output.description: This is the output MSE value. It is a floating point number

pseudotime.description: Pseudotime is a tool used to construct the trajectory of changes between cells to reshape the process of cell changes over time.

input.name: annotation_file
input.description: A preprocessed RDS file with cell clustering annotations.

output.name: cell_trajectory_image
output.description: The image file contains images colored with pseudotime values and colored with cell types.

qda.description: This is a tool for classification. input two csv files, namely the training set and the test set. Also input a column name for the label column. Use this tool to train on the training set, then predict on the test set, and output the prediction result file on the test set. the output result file adds a predicted value column "Predicted" compared to the input test set. The algorithm used is QDA algorithm.

input.name: train_csv_file
input.description: This is the input training set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: test_csv_file
input.description: This is the input test set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: target
input.description: This is the column name of the input label column. It is a string

output.name: result_csv_file
output.description: The output is the result file of the test set. It is a csv file with a total of (n+1) columns. The column name of the predicted value column is "Predicted"

randomforest.description: This is a tool for classification. input two csv files, namely the training set and the test set. Also input a column name for the label column. Use this tool to train on the training set, then predict on the test set, and output the prediction result file on the test set. the output result file adds a predicted value column "Predicted" compared to the input test set. The algorithm used is randomforest algorithm.

input.name: train_csv_file
input.description: This is the input training set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: test_csv_file
input.description: This is the input test set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: target
input.description: This is the column name of the input label column. It is a string.

output.name: result_csv_file
output.description: The output is the result file of the test set. It is a csv file with a total of (n+1) columns. The column name of the predicted value column is "Predicted"

randomforest_regression.description: This is a tool for regression. Input two csv files, namely the training set and the test set. Also input a column name for the label column. Use this tool to train on the training set, then predict on the test set, and output the prediction result file on the test set. The output result file adds a predicted value column "Predicted" compared to the input test set. The algorithm used is randomforest algorithm.

input.name: train_csv_file
input.description: This is the input training set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: test_csv_file
input.description: This is the input test set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: target
input.description: This is the column name of the input label column. It is a string.

output.name: result_csv_file
output.description: The output is the result file of the test set. It is a csv file with a total of (n+1) columns. The column name of the predicted value column is "Predicted"

regression.description:
A linear regression model tool,This tool should be called directly without the need for an "import" statement. input two csv files, namely the training set and the test set. Also input a column name for the label column. Use this tool to train on the training set, then predict on the test set, and output the prediction result file on the test set. the output result file adds a predicted value column "Predicted" compared to the input test set.
The algorithm used is linear regression algorithm.

input.name: train_csv_file
input.description: This is the input training set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: test_csv_file
input.description: This is the input test set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: target
input.description: This is the column name of the input label column. It is a string.

output.name: result_csv_file
output.description: The output is the result file of the test set. It is a csv file with a total of (n+1) columns. The column name of the predicted value column is "Predicted".

ROC.description: ROC is a tool to plot receiver operating characteristic curve.

input.name: input_file
input.description: A text file. The first column is the classification label, and the other columns are different variables along with their corresponding observed values.

output.name: out_ROC_file
output.description: The ROC curve figure.

Samtools.description: It is a toolset for working with SAM and BAM files.

input.name: SAM_file
input.description: Contains sequence alignment results generated by HISAT2 or other alignment tools.

output.name: BAM_file
output.description: The BAM format is a binary version of the SAM file, which takes up less space and is faster to read and process.

seurat_clustering.description: Seurat_clustering is a tool for cell clustering of 10x single-cell transcriptome data generated by Cell Ranger.

input.name: filtered_file
input.description: Quality controlled and standardized seurat objects.

output.name: clusters_feature_image
output.description: The image contains the expression level of some markers in all cluster groups

output.name: clusters_Marker_file
output.description: The csv file is the matrix composed of the top 10 differentially expressed genes in each cluster.

output.name: clusters_HeatMap_image
output.description: Heat map of the top 10 differentially expressed genes in each cluster.

output.name: clusters_umap_image
output.description: UMAP of cluster groups.

output.name: clusters_data_file
output.description: Seruat objects after clustering, including barcodes, genes, and expression.

seurat_preprocess.description: seurat_preprocess is a single cell data preprocessing tool based on QC indicators for cell selection and filtering, data normalization and scaling, and detection of highly variable features.

input.name: genes_file
input.description: The genes information file contains gene name and gene ID.

input.name: matrix_file
input.description: The matrix file is an mtx file that stores matrix representation data in sparse matrix format.

input.name: barcodes_file
input.description: The barcodes information tsv file contains all cellular barcodes present for that sample. Barcodes are listed in the order of data presented in the matrix file (i.e. these are the column names).

output.name: QC_metrics_image
output.description: QC indicators visualization.("nFeature_RNA", "nCount_RNA", "percent.mt")

output.name: variable_features_image
output.description: The figure of feature subsets with high intercellular variability.

output.name: filtered_file
output.description: Quality controlled and standardized seurat objects.

seurat_preprocess_rds.description: seurat_preprocess is a single cell data preprocessing tool based on QC indicators for cell selection and filtering, data normalization and scaling, and detection of highly variable features.

input.name: rds_file
input.description: 10x single-cell transcriptome data created using seruat

output.name: QC_metrics_image
output.description: QC indicators visualization.("nFeature_RNA", "nCount_RNA", "percent.mt")

output.name: variable_features_image
output.description: The figure of feature subsets with high intercellular variability.

output.name: filtered_file
output.description: Quality controlled and standardized seurat objects.

signature.description: signature is a tool used for analyzing somatic variants in samples and determining the abundance of mutational signatures.

input.name: sig_input
input.description: The input file is a tab-delimited text file containing genetic variant information for samples. It includes columns for sample ID, chromosome, position, reference allele, and alternate allele.

input.name: bsg_type
input.description: This parameter specifies the reference genome to be used for variant annotation. It can be either "BSgenome.Hsapiens.UCSC.hg19" or "BSgenome.Hsapiens.UCSC.hg38".

output.name: out_file
output.description: The output file is a tab-delimited text file containing the results of the mutational signature analysis. It includes the sample ID and the abundance of mutational signatures observed in the samples.

singleR_annotation.description: singleR_annotation is a tool for cell type recognition from single-cell RNA sequencing data using a reference transcriptome dataset.

input.name: clusters_file
input.description: Seurat objects after preprocessing, dimensionality reduction, and clustering.

output.name: annotion_umap_image
output.description: UMAP diagram automatically annotated by SingleR.

output.name: scores_within_cells_image
output.description: Heat map of cell scores in an annotated label.

output.name: annotation_file
output.description: Annotated single-cell data, including annotated labels, scores, and other data.

split_data_tool.description:
Input a csv file, which is the original data set. The column name of the label column is "Target". Use this tool to divide this csv file into a training set and a test set, and then output the result files of the training set and test set.
The default split ratio for the tool is 0.8-0.2.File loading has been implemented internally within the tool, and no additional file loading is required before the tool.

input.name: dataset_csv_file
input.description: This is the input original data set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns. The column name of the label column is "Target"

output.name: train_csv_file
output.description: This is the result file of the output training set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns. The column name of the label column is "Target"

output.name: test_csv_file
output.description: This is the result file of the output test set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns. The column name of the label column is "Target"

ssGSEA.description: ssGSEA (single-sample gene set enrichment analysis) is a method for gene set enrichment analysis, used to analyze the enrichment level of biological processes or pathways in gene expression data.

input.name: inf_set
input.description: The file format is a text file, with tab (\t) used as the delimiter between fields. It contains two columns, each representing a biological pathway (TGF_pathway and BMP_pathway). Each row lists the genes belonging to the respective pathway.

input.name: inf_exp
input.description: The file is an expression file delimited by tabs (\t), with rows representing genes and columns representing samples.

output.name: out_file
output.description: A text file including results of ssGSEA

stringtie.description: This is a tool for assembling and quantifying RNA-Seq data.

input.name: bam_file
input.description: The BAM format is a binary version of the SAM file, which takes up less space and is faster to read and process.

output.name: gtf_file
output.description: Contains information on assembled transcripts.

stringtie_merge.description: stringtie_merge is a subfunction of stringtie, used to integrate transcript assembly results from multiple RNA-Seq samples.

input.name: gtf_file
input.description: Contains information on assembled transcripts.

output.name: gtf_file
output.description: Merged transcript file

survival_curve.description: survival_curve is a tool to plot the survival curve using survival time, event status, and variables that may affect survival.

input.name: survival_file
input.description: The survival-related text file. # The following information must be included:Survival Time,Event Status,Covariates

input.name: time
input.description: The column name in survival_file where the survival time is located.

input.name: event
input.description: The column name in survival_file where the event status is located.

input.name: variable
input.description: The column name in survival_file where variables that may affect survival is located.

output.name: out_survival_curve_image
output.description: The survival curve figure.

svm.description: This is a tool for classification. input two csv files, namely the training set and the test set. Also input a column name for the label column. Use this tool to train on the training set, then predict on the test set, and output the prediction result file on the test set. the output result file adds a predicted value column "Predicted" compared to the input test set. The algorithm used is SVM algorithm.

input.name: train_csv_file
input.description: This is the input training set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: test_csv_file
input.description: This is the input test set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: target
input.description: This is the column name of the input label column. It is a string.

output.name: result_csv_file
output.description: The output is the result file of the test set. It is a csv file with a total of (n+1) columns. The column name of the predicted value column is "Predicted"

This is a tool for regression. input two csv files, namely the training set and the test set. Also input a column name for the label column. Use this tool to train on the training set, then predict on the test set, and output the prediction result file on the test set. the output result file adds a predicted value column "Predicted" compared to the input test set.

input.description: This is the input training set. It is a csv file with a total of n columns.

input.name: test_csv_file

vcf_to_maf.description: A tool used to convert a VCF file into a MAF file

input.name: vcf_file
input.description: Variant Call Format files

output.name: maf_file
output.description: Mutation annotation information (MAF) format file, The naming convention for output files is to replace ".vcf" in the input file name with ".maf". e.g:Input:"tumor.recal.vcf" Output: "tumor.recal.maf", Input:"tumor_paired.vcf" Output: "tumor_paired.maf"

venn.description: venn is a tool to plot the venn diagram.

input.name: dataset_file
input.description: The text file containing datasets from various groups. Each column is a dataset for a group, with the column name being the name of the group.

output.name: out_venn_image
output.description: The venn diagram.

wgcna.description: The wgcna algorithm is used to mine gene modules with strong correlation between gene expression profiles and group information.

input.name: exp_file
input.description: The expression profile csv file(No preprocessing required).

input.name: group_file
input.description: The group information csv file(No preprocessing required).

output.name: genes_modules_image
output.description: Gene module clustering diagram, used to display how many gene modules are divided.

output.name: module_relationships_trait_image
output.description: Used to show the correlation between gene modules and group information.

output.name: top_hub_gene_file
output.description: The gene module with the strongest correlation with group information.
